page.title: 12PUBLIC SERVICES IN MORETON
page.content: The{firestation}in Moreton was opened in 1968.The fire engine they use is a Dennis Water Carrier.The hoses are 21 metres long.They have 20 hoses.The tank holds 2275 litres.The engine has Breathing Apparatus and a fog horn on board.They have to test the apparatus every week to see if it works. At the {Ambulance}station there are 2 dual- purpose (for emergency and routine) ambulances.They use V.H.F. radios and specialised{equipment.}They also have Breathing Apparatus and 3 cylinders of oxygen.Sometimes they get mentally disturbed people so there are special ties to prevent the ambulance men from being hurt.They are allowed to travel at speeds up to 145 k.p.h. when called out to an emergency.There are eleven ambulance men and they have a shift system to give 24 hour cover.
